intro: Silene yarmalii, commonly known as Yarmal’s catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Silene yarmalii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
